justification: Proposal notes B’s desire for big-play WRs and playoff schedules, but misses key beliefs: B trusts consensus and avoids injury risk, and would not gut RB depth. Trading Harris and Nelson leaves B with only Green (questionable) and Sam Reed at RB—untenable for a 6–2, consensus-driven manager. Rationale is generic and frames B as ceiling-seeking, not balanced. A’s floor-seeking also conflicts with A’s ceiling-chasing style. Value is plausible, but ToM fit is weak.
